channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: COVID-19 cases in Philippines breach 65,000 with 2,357 new infections
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: (Updated 4:26 p.m.) More than 13.61 million cases of the coronavirus, including around 585,000 deaths, have been recorded globally by the World Health Organization in its latest situation report.

item.title: Groups to wage noise barrage, motorcade vs anti-terror law, ABS-CBN franchise denial
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: The planned activities coincide with the taking effect of the Anti-Terrorism Act of 2020 today.

item.title: Senators to DOH: Use cheaper Filipino-made COVID-19 test kits instead of imported brands
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: The Filipino-made test kits funded by the DOST are cheaper compared to Chinese and Korean test kits which cost more than double, between P4,000 and P8,000.

item.title: CA’s Baltazar-Padilla named to Supreme Court
item.author: Robertzon Ramirez
item.description: Court of Appeals Associate Justice Priscilla Baltazar-Padilla yesterday took her oath of office as associate justice of the Supreme Court.

item.title: DepEd expects more students to enroll
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: Despite the end of the 45-day enrollment period in public schools last Wednesday, the Department of Education (DepEd) still anticipates an increase in the number of enrollees in the coming weeks.

item.title: Lagundi being tested vs COVID-19
item.author: Rainier Allan Ronda
item.description: The University of the Philippines-Philippine General Hospital clinical trials on lagundi as treatment for coronavirus disease 2019 are set to start after the UP-PGH ethics committee issued clearance for the tests, Science Secretary Fortunato dela Peña said before the weekend.

item.title: Foreigners with long-term visas can enter Philippines
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: Starting next month, foreign nationals with existing long-term visas especially permanent residents will be allowed entry to the Philippines.

item.title: BFP to assist in house search
item.author: Emmanuel Tupas
item.description: The Bureau of Fire Protection has deployed its chemical, biological, radiological, nuclear and explosives or CBRNE teams to assist in the house-to-house search for coronavirus disease 2019 patients.

item.title: ‘Overworked, underpaid’ nurses want better conditions
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: Nurses who described themselves as “overworked and underpaid” nurses denounced the delay in government efforts to address the concern of healthcare workers regarding their safety and family’s well-being amid the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic.

item.title: Anti-Terrorism Law takes effect today
item.author: Robertzon Ramirez
item.description: Denounced on several fronts and challenged before the Supreme Court, the Anti-Terrorism Act of 2020 takes effect today – even in the absence of implementing rules and regulations.
